Job Title: Project Manager (Digital Media)

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Department: Engagement - Americas

Employment Type: Permanent - Full Time

Location: USA - Remote

Reporting To: Mike Solomon

Compensation: $65,000 - $70,000 / year

Description

This is an integral role within the North American Engagement team and Ebiquity, supporting the effective delivery of profitable client projects, with an emphasis on large clients of our digital media performance services.

As a Project Manager with an emphasis in the digital portfolio of Ebiquity solutions, you ensure that your client projects are properly planned, resourced, and delivered to budget, quality and time through working with Engagement Client Lead, and colleagues from the other specialisms in the business – Insights, Activation, Production and Solutions. You play an essential role in coordinating with other internal stakeholders including planning, reporting, and managing any changes to the work to ensure high performance, on-time, and in-scope delivery of all projects.

You are a core member of the Engagement Project Management community, helping to ensure that all client projects are managed using the standardized Ebiquity project management process and platform. You will contribute to the creation and maintenance of project management best practice collateral and will support the roll-out of our standard operating procedures across the Ebiquity network. You will have a full and thorough understanding of each solution’s timeline, project plan, and the main output of each stage in the process – particularly for our digital solutions. Excellent communications skills and the ability to align across internal stakeholders are crucial to this role.

Key Responsibilities

 Be responsible for the project management of the service delivery for clients with a heavy focus on digital deliverables within the Engagement client group team, led by the Engagement Client Lead Clearly document the fundamental components of each project (scope, schedule, planning, SLA’s, resource requirements, budgets, risks, assumptions, issues, dependencies, and quality requirements), using simple standard forms and templates Ensure that the projects for which you are responsible are properly planned, resourced, and delivered to budget, quality and time Assurance that timelines are met and that key stakeholders are kept up-to-date throughout the process Establish and maintain the governance arrangements for the delivery of projects, defining clear roles, responsibilities, and accountabilities Ensure that the projects for which you are responsible are properly planned, resourced, and delivered to budget, quality and time Support the Engagement Client Lead in collaboration with the resource managers in other specialisms to secure the provision of resources needed for project delivery Capture the key information from the resource allocation plans for projects using the Ebiquity resource planning/management tools to enable ongoing tracking of the project performance against planned hours/costs Ensure that the specialism team leads (e.g. Insights, Activation, and Production) create a work plan for their tasks within our project management platform, and that the specialism team lead reviews and updates progress against the plan on a weekly basis Conduct regular progress reviews, and capture and raise any risks or issues affecting the project in user-friendly status reports for the client and internal teams Provide regular updates as required to internal stakeholders, and support client leads in any external communications related to project management and status. Ensure client contacts are engaged with on a pre-agreed frequency, and that meetings are scheduled and properly documented and actioned Ensure that a quality management process applies for project activities and outputs. Ensure that the outputs, and processes through which they are delivered, are meeting stakeholder requirements, and are fit for purpose

Skills, Knowledge and Expertise

 3+ years’ experience in marketing or media (digital experience preferred) at a consultancy, agency or client side, or equivalent experience Possess a working knowledge of digital media and how it is planned, traded, and tracked Experience in project managing within marketing, media, auditing, consultancy or similar client projects Ability to influence and persuade stakeholders of all levels Ability to build internal and external trust through a combination of establishing a high standard of delivery, meeting commitments, and building rapport with internal and external constituents Exceptional communication skills to explain requirements from colleagues and stakeholders simply and clearly Experience in working in matrix organisations and ability to collaborate with stakeholders across the team to to deliver client projects Capable of contributing to management of resources to plans and/or targets and general knowledge of budget management. Self-motivated with excellent organizational and time management skills Ability to work under pressure and prioritize conflicting demands Preferred previous experience with project management tools such as Smartsheet, Asana or Monday.com Ability to critically think and problem solve Experience working with colleagues in different time zones is a strong plus

Benefits

 You will be a trusted advisor to some of the biggest and strongest global advertisers. A collaborative working environment characterized by great professionalism and respect for the individual. A learning environment with time allocated to learn and develop.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
